User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux i686; en-US; rv:1.7) Gecko/20040615 Firefox/0.9
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux i686; en-US; rv:1.7) Gecko/20040615 Firefox/0.9

I'm trying moznx[1] extension to have freenx running on the browser. Although I still didn't manage to have it running, there are a few points, along with crash that I'd like to report.

The backtraced firefox was version 1.5.0.9, built for Fedora Core 6 (RPM release 1.fc6). The crash may be related to some incompatibility from moznx (just guessing) but, anyway, I think FF shouldn't crash this way. I hope this backtrace will help to circumvent these situations in the future.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Follow the instructions to deploy moznx in a webserver
2. Point firefox to the test page url
3. click "install" to install the plugin
4. click TEST.

Actual Results:  
It will sometimes crash without dumping the backtrace. I got this one once in some 5 oe 6 tests.

I am testing moznx in firefox versions 1.0 and 0.9, and it does *NOT* crash, so probably this is a compatibility issue; anyway, it shouldn't crash like this.


Expected Results:  
Firefox should circumvent extensions crashing, I guess...

Here is the backtrace:

I'm trying moznx[1] extension to have freenx running on the browser. Although I still didn't manage to have it running, there are a few points, along with crash that I'd like to report.

The backtraced firefox was version 1.5.0.9, built for Fedora Core 6 (RPM release 1.fc6). The crash may be related to some incompatibility from moznx (just guessing) but, anyway, I think FF shouldn't crash this way. I hope this backtrace will help to circumvent these situations in the future.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Follow the instructions to deploy moznx in a webserver
2. Point firefox to the test page url
3. click "install" to install the plugin
4. click TEST.

Actual Results:  
It will sometimes crash without dumping the backtrace. I got this one once in some 5 oe 6 tests.

I am testing moznx in firefox versions 1.0 and 0.9, and it does *NOT* crash, so probably this is a compatibility issue; anyway, it shouldn't crash like this.


Expected Results:  
Firefox should circumvent extensions crashing, I guess...

comments.text:
Badly written extensions are allowed to crash.  We're trying to address that with Jetpack, but it will take a while.

In the mean time, if you can provide a *simple* extension that does something reasonable-looking but crashes, we'll try to fix it :)  A real stack trace would help too.  But do that in a new bug, so the long and useless thing at the bottom of comment 0 doesn't scare people away.
comments.creator: jruderman@gmail.com

comments.text:
oh brother. jesse: that's a crash from libclearlooks which is a theme engine.

reporter please complain to whomever wrote clearlooks.

if you'd like us to blacklist that theme engine, we could arrange to do so.

given that this is filed against 1.5, it's not worth doing anything without a stack from 3.6 or newer.
